== '''Mac Setup Guide''' ==
This page will guide you how to setup C++ development environment on Mac using Clion and how to set gdb for debugging purposes.

'''Setup Xcode'''

 1. Install [https://apps.apple.com/us/app/xcode/id497799835?mt=12 Xcode] from Mac App Store. After the installation is finished, open it and it will start installing additional necessary things.

 2. Open terminal, type '''`xcode-select --install`'''  Follow the prompts to let it install necessary components (Xcode Command Line Tools)

'''Setup Homebrew'''

 Install [https://brew.sh/ Homebrew] if you haven't done so. Homebrew is a powerful package management tool for Mac and everyone is highly recommended install it.

'''Setup CLion'''
 
 1. Download and install [https://www.jetbrains.com/clion/download/#section=mac CLion V.2019.2.2] for Mac OS X. We recommend using the latest version, but you don't have to.

 2. Go to the [https://grape.ics.uci.edu/wiki/public/wiki/cs222-2019-fall-project1-create-project deployment guide] to set up the codebase for project 1. 

You can check [https://intellij-support.jetbrains.com/hc/en-us/?clion&_ga=2.267696071.859169998.1569395372-1000868039.1569395372 this forum] for more support on CLion.

'''Set up LLDB/GDB for debugging purposes'''

As for the debugger, CLion includes bundled GDB 8.1 for Linux and Windows (note, no GDB is bundled for Cygwin on Windows) and GDB 8.0 for macOS, bundled LLDB 5.0 on macOS and Linux. Custom GDB 7.8.x-8.1.x can be selected in CLion settings as well.

If you are not using CLion, you can install GDB with Homebrew:
'''`brew install gdb`'''

'''Set up Valgrind for debugging purposes'''

Valgrind is a very powerful tool to detect memory leaks in your program. As of 09/25/2019, the latest release of Valgrind (3.15.0) will support ONLY up to '''macOS 10.13 High Sierra'''. 

* You can use homebrew to install Valgrind directly '''`brew install --HEAD valgrind`'''.

* Instead, you may also build it from source:


      Installation:

      1. Install git using homebrew:  '''`brew install git`'''
      1. Install automake using homebrew: '''` brew install automake `'''
      1. Clone Valgrind's git repository: '''` git clone git://sourceware.org/git/valgrind.git `'''
      1. cd into the valgrind folder: '''` cd valgrind `'''
      1. run '''` ./autogen.sh `'''
      1. run '''` ./configure `'''
      1. run '''` make `'''
      1. run '''` make install `'''
